questions.question: A store reduces the price of a jacket from $80 to $60. What is the percent decrease in the price?
questions.explanation: Percent decrease = (original - new)/original × 100 = (80 - 60)/80 × 100 = 20/80 × 100 = 25%. A common error is calculating 20/60 = 33.3%, which uses the wrong base.
